required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Evaluating Pharmacovigilance Of Refacto AF
clinical_study.official_title: Pharmacovigilance Evaluation Of Refacto Af (Registered) In Germany And Austria

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this observational study is to describe the incidence of adverse events among patients treated with Refacto AF in usual health care settings in Germany and Austria.

detailed_description.textblock: Non-interventional study: subjects to be selected according to the usual clinical practice of their physician

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline until last visit (up to 87 months)
primary_outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study treatment without regard to possibility of causal relationship. SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability or incapacity; cancer; congenital anomaly. Treatment-emergent are events between first dose of study drug and up to last visit (up to 87 months) that were absent before treatment or that worsened relative to pretreatment state. AEs included both serious and non-serious adverse events.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-Related Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline until last visit (up to 87 months)
primary_outcome.description: Treatment-related AE was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to study drug in a participant who received study drug. SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; cancer; congenital anomaly. AEs included both serious and non-serious adverse events. Relatedness of AEs with Refacto AF was assessed by the investigator.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Factor VIII (FVIII) Inhibitor Development as Measured by the Nijmegen-Modified Bethesda Assay
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline until last visit (up to 87 months)
primary_outcome.description: FVIII inhibitor development was defined as measured inhibitor titer of greater than (>) 0.6 Bethesda Units (BU) using the Nijmegen-modified Bethesda assay.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Total Number of Bleeding Episodes in Participants
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline until last visit (up to 87 months)
primary_outcome.description: Participants documented all bleeding episodes in a diary during the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Total Number of Bleeding Episodes Per Year in Participants
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline until last visit (up to 87 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Participants documented all bleeding episodes in a diary during the study. Mean total number of bleeding episodes per year was calculated as: mean total number of bleeding episodes divided by duration of observation period (in years) for bleeding documentation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Change From Baseline Status in Days Missed From School or Work
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline until last visit (up to 87 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline status in days missed from school or work was categorized in 3 categories: Improvement, unchanged and worsening. Improvement defined as a decrease in number of days missed by participants from school/work as compared to baseline; worsening was defined as an increase in number of days missed by participants from school/work as compared to baseline; unchanged was defined as no change in number of days missed by participants from school/work as compared to baseline. In this outcome measure, number of participants with change from baseline status (as improved, worsen, unchanged) in days missed from school/work were reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participant Assessment of Satisfaction With Treatment Handling
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of study visit (any time up to 87 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Participants evaluated their satisfaction with handing (administration) of Refacto AF and rated it in 4 categories as: very satisfied, satisfied, unsatisfied and very unsatisfied.

secondary_outcome.measure: Investigator Assessment of Treatment Satisfaction of Participants
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of study visit (any time up to 87 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator assessed the treatment satisfaction of participants and categorized as very satisfied, satisfied, unsatisfied, or very unsatisfied.

intervention.description: Patients will be treated with intravenous infusion of ReFacto AF per dosing and frequency as prescribed by the subjects' treating physician. ReFacto AF® will be prescribed in the context of routine clinical practice in Germany and Austria, respectively

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with hemophilia A of any severity already receiving or starting treatment with ReFacto AF.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with Hemophilia A treated with a product other than Refacto AF.

facility.name: LKH - Univ. Klinikum Graz,Abt. fur Hamatologie
Universitaetsklinikum Duesseldorf, Klinik f. Kinder-Onkologie, Haematologie u. Klinische Immunologie
Praxis zur Diagnostik und Therapie Von Blutgerinnungstoerungen
Stiftung Deutsche Klinik fur Diagnostik GmbH

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.title: ReFacto AF: On Demand Treatment
group.description: Participants were treated with intravenous (IV) injection of ReFacto AF whenever they had a bleeding episode, as a part of routine clinical practice at a dose and frequency prescribed by treating physician (with a mean recommended dose of 23.0 ± 8.0 international units per kilogram [IU/kg]). Participants were observed for up to a maximum duration of 87 months in this study.

group.title: ReFacto AF: Prophylaxis Treatment
group.description: Participants were treated prophylactically with a regular IV injection of ReFacto AF to prevent any bleeding episode at a dose and frequency prescribed by treating physician (with a mean recommended dose of 26.7 ± 8.4 IU/kg). Participants were observed for up to a maximum duration of 87 months in this study.

group.title: ReFacto AF: Intermediate Prophylaxis Treatment
group.description: Participants had intermediate prophylaxis (regular dosing with drug at a low dose than the defined prophylactic treatment) treatment with a regular IV injection of ReFacto AF to prevent any bleeding episode at a dose and frequency prescribed by treating physician (with a mean recommended dose of less than [>] 26.7 ± 8.4 IU/kg). Participants were observed for up to a maximum duration of 87 months in this study.

baseline.population: Safety analysis set included all participants with informed consent and treated with at least 1 dose of ReFacto AF.

group.title: ReFacto AF: On Demand Treatment
group.description: Participants were treated with intravenous (IV) injection of ReFacto AF whenever they had a bleeding episode, as a part of routine clinical practice at a dose and frequency prescribed by treating physician (with a mean recommended dose of 23.0 ± 8.0 international units per kilogram [IU/kg]). Participants were observed for up to a maximum duration of 87 months in this study.

Participants were observed for up to a maximum duration of 87 months in this study.

outcome.title: Mean Total Number of Bleeding Episodes in Participants
outcome.description: Participants documented all bleeding episodes in a diary during the study.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline until last visit (up to 87 months)
outcome.population: Effectiveness analysis set =participants registered in study and had at least 1 dose of ReFacto AF documented by participants diary entries. Participant’s registration included confirmation of obtained participant’s informed consent from the physician. Here, 'N' (number of participants analyzed) = participants evaluable for this outcome measure.

Participant’s registration included confirmation of obtained participant’s informed consent from the physician. Here, 'N' =participants evaluable for this outcome measure.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Change From Baseline Status in Days Missed From School or Work
outcome.description: Change from baseline status in days missed from school or work was categorized in 3 categories: Improvement, unchanged and worsening. Improvement defined as a decrease in number of days missed by participants from school/work as compared to baseline; worsening was defined as an increase in number of days missed by participants from school/work as compared to baseline; unchanged was defined as no change in number of days missed by participants from school/work as compared to baseline. In this outcome measure, number of participants with change from baseline status (as improved, worsen, unchanged) in days missed from school/work were reported.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline until last visit (up to 87 months)
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on effectiveness analysis set. Here, 'N' signifies those participants who were evaluable for this outcome measure. For this outcome measure, data for Refacto AF: intermediate prophylaxis treatment arm could not be analyzed since all participants of this arm were neither working nor school going.

group.title: ReFacto AF: On Demand Treatment

In this outcome measure, number of participants with change from baseline status (as improved, worsen, unchanged) in days missed from school/work were reported.

For this outcome measure, data for Refacto AF: intermediate prophylaxis treatment arm could not be analyzed since all participants of this arm were neither working nor school going.

reported_events.desc: Same event may appear as both an AE and SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one participant and as non-serious in another, or a participant may have experienced both a serious and non-serious event.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)
Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Prioritization of outcome measures as primary and secondary was based on the study team’s discretion, as it was not specified in source documents.
